revised_title: The Relationship Between Mechanical Work and Heat in the Condensation of Air
tldr: Joule conducted experiments to study the relationship between mechanical work and heat during the condensation of air. He found that a mechanical force equivalent to raising 823 pounds one foot is needed to raise the temperature of one pound of water one degree Fahrenheit during air condensation. This result supports the dynamical theory of heat, opposing the materiality theory. Joule plans to discuss this further in a future communication.
